title: Firestore Database Setup Instructions
description: Step-by-step guide to set up the Firestore database for the OD Marking App

steps.title: Create Firestore Database
steps.description: Go to Firebase Console > Firestore Database > Create database

steps.title: Set Up Collections
steps.description: Create the required collections with sample documents

collections.name: users
collections.sampleDoc: Use the sample data from seed-data.sql

collections.name: od_requests
collections.sampleDoc: Will be created when students submit requests

collections.name: scan_logs
collections.sampleDoc: Will be created when coordinators scan student IDs

collections.name: departments
collections.sampleDoc: Create departments like CS, EC, ME, etc.

steps.title: Configure Security Rules
steps.description: Apply the security rules from firestore-security-rules.json
details: Replace the default rules with the rules from firestore-security-rules.json

steps.title: Create Composite Indexes
steps.description: Set up indexes for optimized queries
details: Create composite indexes as specified in firestore-indexes.sql
These will be automatically suggested when you run queries

steps.title: Seed Initial Data
details: Use the Firebase Console to manually add documents
Or use the Firebase Admin SDK to bulk import data
Follow the structure defined in seed-data.sql

security_features: User can only access their own data
Teachers can view students in their department
Coordinators can manage events and scan logs
